item.title: Music
item.description: Diary Tape This recording uses audio diary entries and long-form solo improvisations on upright bass, synths, banjo and drums. I had the idea in mind to fill two sides of a 40 minute tape with two 20 minute long compositions. Here it is in its entirety. Diary Tape by Slow Man Tofu Steer The largest-scope Slow Man Tofu album - Steer - was co-produced by myself and Matt Rogalsky of Memory Device (PS I Love You, The Gertrudes).

item.title: Video
item.description: So much to remember - Garden Take is a Dance Flower music video. Starting Bands by Slow Man Tofu. Produced by Sian Alcorn. A music video for the improvised guitar jam ‘fragile’. Shot in Halifax, NS. This music video I created for a small side project called ‘Snakes 4 President’. Here is a music video I made for Ramblings, from the album Steer, released August 2016.

item.title: Reviews
item.description: David Parker and Linsey Wellman - Live at IMOO, Ottawa 2017 I particularly enjoyed Parker's bass playing, with his imaginative use of arco techniques and muting to create different sounds, and how he combined the bass with pre-recorded loops. Wellman impressively expanded his repertoire with the baritone (sax), retaining his own style and using the different capabilities of that instrument to create beautiful sounds. And playing together they showed considerable empathy and coordination.

item.title: About
item.description: Slow Man Tofu is the singer-songwriter project of musician David Parker. Parker plays in musical, interdisciplinary projects that are experimental, drone, and improvised, collaborating in ensembles and performing solo improvised work. Under the name Slow Man Tofu he has released a full-length album with producer Matt Rogalsky and performed dozens of shows around Ontario and Quebec. For 4 years he played upright bass and electronics as part of the experimental duo Fire Moss.
